snippet: In his unorthodox campaign for the 2016 Republican nomination, Senator Rand Paul is bringing his libertarian conservatism to audiences that are more inclined to vote Democratic.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul's unorthodox campaign for 2016 Republican presidential nomination is based on hope that his brand of libertarian conservatism will appeal to audiences more inclined to vote Democratic; Paul faces challenge of actually attracting votes, and his campaign will be test of whether his attempt to rebrand Republican Party can happen in a year or whether it will take more time, if it can happen at all.
lead_paragraph: In his unorthodox campaign for the 2016 Republican nomination, Senator Rand Paul is bringing his libertarian conservatism to audiences that are more inclined to vote Democratic.

headline.main: Rand Paul Is Capturing an Audience; the Challenge Is Winning Votes
headline.print_headline: Paul Is Capturing an Audience; the Challenge Is Winning Votes
